com.nutiteq.geometry
Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.geometry.VectorElement
      com.nutiteq.geometry.Geometry
          com.nutiteq.geometry.Polygon

public class Polygon
extends Geometry

Geometric polygon on the map. Polygons can be non-convex and may contain holes.

Constructor Detail

Polygon

public Polygon(java.util.List<MapPos> mapPoses,
               Label label,
               PolygonStyle polygonStyle,
               java.lang.Object userData)
Default constructor (can be used if single style is sufficient for all zoom levels and polygon does not contain any holes).

Parameters:
mapPoses - vertices of the polygon. Vertices are defined in the coordinate system of the layer this element is attached to.
label - the label for the polygon. Label is shown when the polygon is selected. Can be null.
polygonStyle - style for displaying the polygon (color, texture, etc).
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

Polygon

public Polygon(java.util.List<MapPos> mapPoses,
               Label label,
               StyleSet<PolygonStyle> styles,
               java.lang.Object userData)
Constructor for the case when style depends on zoom level and polygon does not contain any holes.

Parameters:
mapPoses - vertices of the polygon. Vertices are defined in the coordinate system of the layer this element is attached to.
label - the label for the polygon. Label is shown when the polygon is selected. Can be null.
styles - style set defining how to display the polygon.
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

Polygon

public Polygon(java.util.List<MapPos> mapPoses,
               java.util.List<java.util.List<MapPos>> mapPosesHoles,
               Label label,
               PolygonStyle polygonStyle,
               java.lang.Object userData)
Constructor for the case if single style is sufficient for all zoom levels and polygon contains holes.

Parameters:
mapPoses - vertices of the polygon. Vertices are defined in the coordinate system of the layer this element is attached to.
mapPosesHoles - list of hole polygons. Can be null.
label - the label for the polygon. Label is shown when the polygon is selected. Can be null.
polygonStyle - style for displaying the polygon (color, texture, etc).
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

label - the label for the polygon. Label is shown when the polygon is selected. Can be null.
styles - style set defining how to display the polygon.
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

getHolePolygonList

public java.util.List<java.util.List<MapPos>> getHolePolygonList()
Get the list of hole polygons.

Returns:
list of all hole polygons. The list is unmodifiable and can be null if there are no holes.

getInternalState

public com.nutiteq.geometry.Polygon.PolygonInternalState getInternalState()
Description copied from class: VectorElement
Not part of public API. This method is intended for renderers.

calculateInternalState

public void calculateInternalState()
Description copied from class: VectorElement
Not part of public API. This method should be called only vector layers - if layer internal state (like projection) changes, this method will recalculate internal state to reflect the change. The best pattern for implementation is to calculate the needed state and then call setInternalState at the end with newly constructed internal state object. NOTE: this method can be called from multiple threads, thus it should be implemented with this in mind.

getInternalEnvelope

public Envelope getInternalEnvelope()
Description copied from class: VectorElement
Calculate element envelope in internal coordinates.

Returns:
element envelope in internal coordinates

calculateInternalClickPos

public Point3D calculateInternalClickPos(Point3D clickPos)
Description copied from class: VectorElement
Calculate element click position based on world coordinates. This method is called only from renderer thread.

Parameters:
clickPos - original click position in world coordinates. Note: null is a valid input, in that case default position should be returned.
Returns:
recalculated click position in world coordinates.

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
